results.title: The Natural landscape
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Film Australia’s Australia”.
The series deals with changes in the physical, social, cultural, political and economic spheres of Australian life, utilising material dating from the beginnings of filmmaking in this country, in the early 1900s.

results.title: The Natural
results.creator_credit: Barry Levinson, Mark Johnson, Delphi II and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Bernard Malamud, “The Natural” is one of those heroic, feel good, fairy tale films that captures the human spirit. It is a tale of boyhood dreams, of a certain defiance to turn the dream into reality and become a legend and a superhero in that passionate game of American games, baseball, and of a chance encounter with a mysterious woman that will eventually and catastrophically shatter those very dreams. Robert Redford plays the quiet and unassuming middle-aged Roy Hobbs who at the age of 14 hand-carved his own baseball bat from a tree struck down by lightning on the farm where he lived. It was Roy’s dream to play baseball in the major league and it would be his “wonder boy” bat many years later that would take him to stardom and the major league team, the New York Knights. But like all fairy tales, where good and evil battle it out, Hobbs has his own demons to deal with in the form of knockers, corruption and those who would wish to see him, and the New York Knights, fail. The story climaxes to a tense and spectacular final sequence as our hero takes the bat in a nail-biting challenge to win the pennant for his Knights. This is not a film to be taken too seriously and there are many holes in the plot, but it features a wonderful cast including Glenn Close, Kim Basinger, Robert Duvall, Barbara Hershey, Richard Farnsworth and an uncredited appearance by Darren McGavin.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Barry Levinson, Mark Johnson, Delphi II and Tri-Star Pictures

results.title: The Nativity
results.creator_credit: Dudley Shaw Ashton and Samaritan Films
results.brief_description: The famous painting of the “Nativity” by Piero della Francesca (1416-1492) is in the collection of the National Gallery, London. Sir Philip Hendy talks about the painting which is seen alone, as a whole and in detail, without any other effects. The “Nativity” was among della Francesca’s last pictures, executed shortly before he gave up painting due to failing eyesight. Its unfinished appearance is due to harsh restoration of a later period. Narrated by Sir Philip Handy.

results.title: The Nativity
results.brief_description: The Nativity is one in a series of Bible episodes seen through the eyes of three young visitors from the 20th Century. On a sure-footed donkey, Mary and Joseph make the journey from Nazareth, where Mary will give birth to their son. The three Magi ride their camels out of distant lands to worship the new-born king, and from Jerusalem, mad King Herod sends his Roman Legionnaires to find the child he fears.

results.title: The National parks of Canada
results.creator_credit: Crawley Films and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Where once there was only Banff, the number of National Parks across Canada now approaches thirty, in accordance with the federal government’s policy of setting aside scenic tracts of land for the enjoyment of present and future generations. This film shows them all. In a coast-to-coast tour it locates each one on a map and shows the scenic features and recreational facilities that each one offers. Sound film without words.

results.title: The National library
results.creator_credit: Jagat Murari, M. Bhavnani and Films Division, Government of India
results.brief_description: Housing over a million books in many languages, India’s National Library at Calcutta provides citizens with an opportunity for the study and enjoyment of the literature of their own and other countries. Copies of all books, periodicals and newspapers published in India are held by the Library and historical documents and rare editions of Indian classics form an important part of the collection.

results.title: The National fitness story
results.creator_credit: Alex Ezard, Shell and Artransa Park Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Fit to Live”.
The Federal Minister for Health briefly introduces the “Fit to Live” series, after which the overall objectives and activities of the National Fitness movement throughout Australia are depicted. Story by Noel McDonald with Commentary by David Low.

results.title: The National driver's test
results.creator_credit: Vern Diamond, Warren V. Bush and CBS News (for Shell)
results.brief_description: Designed to test the viewer’s judgement, knowledge and perception as a driver. Emphasises the importance of anticipating the wrong actions of other drivers and the learning of “defensive” driving techniques. Includes section on high-speed highway accidents. Made with the co-operation of the National Safety Council (USA) and the IBM Corporation. Introduced briefly by Stuart Wagstaff.
